intro: Heteropterys beecheyana var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan velvetleaf, is a species native to Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
